topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55485e796368722facc52700#post_55485e796368722facc52700
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55485d9b63687271a7660600#post_55485d9b63687271a7660600
I think reading something that you dislike will not change to a positive opinion.
I am right?[/bq]
Exactly; if you dislike something you can't just write it off as "you didn't read far enough" if the person legitimately tries to get into it and finds that they don't like it.

That would be like going for say Naruto:
"I don't like this"
"Try ten chapters"
"Okay; I've read it, but I still don't like it"
"Try twenty chapters"
"Okay; I've read it, but I still don't like it"
"Try fifty chapters"
"Okay; I've read it, but I still don't like it"
"Try one hundred chapters"
"Okay; I've read it, but I still don't like it"
"Try 700 chapters"
"Okay; I've read it, but I still don't like it"


I'll admit I'm biased against superhero shonen, but squiggy and trash are equally biased cause they legitimately do not believe it's possible for people to dislike franchises they like and chalk it up to "oh; you haven't read enough into it".  Pretty much every time me, squiggy and trash argue they always go "no no; you have to read further" instead of admitting that people can legitimately dislike things they like.

Pretty much every argument I've had against them summarized:
"Did you like what we like?"
Yes)"*highfive"
No)"Just read more of it. . . Oh you've read all of the manga?  Well then watch all of the anime? . . Oh you've watched the anime?  Well watch the movie? . . Oh you've watched the movie and still don't like it? . . Then read the novel"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
